question: Which one of the following pairs of famous sayings and their sources is correctly matched?
explanation: Satyameva Jayate is a part of a mantra from the ancient Indian scripture Mundaka Upanishad. Following the independence of India, it was adopted as the national motto of India in 26 January 1950. It is inscribed in script at the base of the Lion Capital of Ashoka and forms an integral part of the national emblem.
